OTHERWISE.Definition: under other circumstances, in a different way

DESIRE.Definition: a strong feeling of wanting to have something

MOISTURE.Definition: water in the form of very small drops

HAND FANS.Definition: a hand-held device designed to be waved in order to produce air

ROTATING.Definition: that was moving in a circle around its centre

FANNING.Definition: making someone less hot by waving an object to create air

ARTIFICIALLY.Definition: in a way that is not natural

CELLARS.Definition: storage areas under the ground floor of buildings

CHALLENGED.Definition: invited him to do something difficult

SWEATING.Definition: releasing moisture from the pores of the body

EVAPORATING.Definition: changing into a vapor or gas

EVAPORATED.Definition: changed into a vapor or gas

EVAPORATION.Definition: the process of a liquid changing into vapor or gas

PRIMITIVE.Definition: of a very early stage of development

MASS-MARKET.Definition: market for goods produced in large quantities

SHOUTING OUT.Definition: expressing in public their desire or demand

VENTILATION.Definition: a system for circulating air into rooms

HUMIDITY.Definition: the quantity of water vapour in the air

BINGO.Definition: used to express satisfaction after a sudden and positive event

PATENTED.Definition: obtained a license making him the sole rightful user of his invention for a set period of time

OFF TO THE RACES.Definition: on his way to increasing success

STICKY.Definition: covered with a substance that stays attached to any surface it touches

MUST-HAVE.Definition: that many people wanted to own

UNNECESSARILY.Definition: in a way that is not necessary, needlessly

EVENING OUT.Definition: the fact of being smooth or equal

FLATTENING OUT.Definition: the fact of staying at the same level

VICIOUS CYCLE.Definition: a situation in which one problem leads to another which makes the first one worse

COOLANTS.Definition: liquids or gases that are used to remove heat

IN PLAIN SIGHT.Definition: in a place that is clearly visible

SHUTTERS.Definition: covers for windows that can be closed to keep out the light

AIR DUCTS.Definition: pipes that go through buildings allowing air to naturally circulate and cool buildings down
